title.en: Biographies of Fan Sui and Cai Ze
title.raw: 《范睢蔡澤列傳》 Biographies of Fan Sui and Cai Ze

sentences.zh: 范睢者，魏人也，字叔。

translations.literal: Fan Sui was a native of Wei, courtesy name Shu.

sentences.zh: 游說諸侯，欲事魏王，家貧無以自資，乃先事魏中大夫須賈。

translations.literal: He traveled among the feudal lords as a persuader, wishing to serve the King of Wei, but being poor with no means to support himself, he first served Xu Jia, the central grand master of Wei.

Fan Sui was a Wei native, styled Shu. He wandered persuading various lords, wishing to serve Wei king, but family poor with no means to support himself, so first served Wei central grand master Xu Jia.

sentences.zh: 須賈為魏昭王使於齊，范睢從。

translations.literal: When Xu Jia served as envoy for King Zhao of Wei to Qi, Fan Sui accompanied him.

sentences.zh: 留數月，未得報。

translations.literal: They stayed for several months without receiving a reply.

sentences.zh: 齊襄王聞睢辯口，乃使人賜睢金十斤及牛酒，睢辭謝不敢受。

translations.literal: King Xiang of Qi heard of Sui's eloquent speech and sent people to grant Sui ten jin of gold and beef and wine. Sui declined with thanks, not daring to accept.

sentences.zh: 須賈知之，大怒，以為睢持魏國陰事告齊，故得此饋，令睢受其牛酒，還其金。

translations.literal: Xu Jia learned of this and flew into a rage, believing that Sui had revealed Wei's secret affairs to Qi and thus received these gifts. He commanded Sui to accept the beef and wine but return the gold.

sentences.zh: 既歸，心怒睢，以告魏相。

translations.literal: Upon returning home, he remained furious with Sui and reported the matter to the Wei chancellor.

sentences.zh: 魏相，魏之諸公子，曰魏齊。

translations.literal: The Wei chancellor was one of Wei's royal princes, named Wei Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏齊大怒，使舍人笞擊睢，折脅摺齒。

translations.literal: Wei Qi flew into a rage and ordered his retainers to cane Sui, breaking his ribs and knocking out his teeth.

sentences.zh: 睢詳死，即卷以簀，置廁中。

translations.literal: Sui feigned death, was rolled up in a mat, and placed in the latrine.

sentences.zh: 賓客飲者醉，更溺睢，故僇辱以懲後，令無妄言者。

translations.literal: The drinking guests got drunk and further urinated on Sui, thus humiliating him to punish others later and ensure no one dared speak rashly.

sentences.zh: 睢從簀中謂守者曰：「公能出我，我必厚謝公。」

translations.literal: Sui from mat told guard: 'You able release me, I certainly thick thank you.'
translations.idiomatic: From within the mat Sui told the guard: 'If you can release me, I will certainly reward you generously.'

sentences.zh: 守者乃請出棄簀中死人。

translations.literal: The guard then requested permission to throw out the dead man in the mat.

sentences.zh: 魏齊醉，曰：「可矣。」

translations.literal: Wei Qi drunk, said: 'Can.'
translations.idiomatic: Wei Qi, being drunk, said: 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 范睢得出。

translations.literal: Fan Sui escaped.

sentences.zh: 後魏齊悔，復召求之。

translations.literal: Later Wei Qi regretted, again summoned sought him.

sentences.zh: 魏人鄭安平聞之，乃遂操范睢亡，伏匿，更名姓曰張祿。

translations.literal: Wei person Zheng Anping heard it, then led Fan Sui fled, hid, changed name surname called Zhang Lu.

Xu Jia as Wei Zhao Wang envoy to Qi, Fan Sui followed. Stayed several months, not getting response. Qi Xiang Wang heard Sui eloquent speech, then sent people grant Sui gold ten jin and beef wine, Sui declined thanked dared not accept. Xu Jia knew it, greatly angered, considered Sui held Wei state secret matters told Qi, thus got this gifts, commanded Sui accept their beef wine, return their gold. After returning home, still angry with Sui, reported to Wei chancellor. Wei chancellor, Wei various crown princes, called Wei Qi. Wei Qi greatly angered, made retainers cane beat Sui, broke ribs knocked out teeth. Sui feigned death, then rolled in mat, placed in latrine. Guests drinking got drunk, moreover urinated on Sui, thus humiliated to punish later, make none dare speak rashly. Sui from mat told guard: 'You able release me, I certainly thick thank you.' Guard then requested throw out dead person in mat. Wei Qi drunk, said: 'Can.' Fan Sui got out. Later Wei Qi regretted, again summoned sought him. Wei person Zheng Anping heard it, then led Fan Sui fled, hid, changed name surname called Zhang Lu.

sentences.zh: 當此時，秦昭王使謁者王稽於魏。

translations.literal: At this time, Qin Zhao Wang made ye zhe Wang Ji go to Wei.

sentences.zh: 鄭安平詐為卒，侍王稽。

translations.literal: Zheng Anping falsely as soldier, served Wang Ji.

sentences.zh: 王稽問：「魏有賢人可與俱西游者乎？」

translations.literal: Wang Ji asked: 'Wei has worthy person can with together west wander?'

sentences.zh: 鄭安平曰：「臣里中有張祿先生，欲見君，言天下事。

translations.literal: Zheng Anping said: 'Minister village has Zhang Lu master, wishes see lord, speak world affairs.

sentences.zh: 其人有仇，不敢晝見。」

translations.literal: That person has enmity, dares not day see.'

sentences.zh: 王稽曰：「夜與俱來。」

translations.literal: Wang Ji said: 'Night with come.'

sentences.zh: 鄭安平夜與張祿見王稽。

translations.literal: Zheng Anping night with Zhang Lu saw Wang Ji.

sentences.zh: 語未究，王稽知范睢賢，謂曰：「先生待我於三亭之南。」

translations.literal: Conversation not complete, Wang Ji knew Fan Sui worthy, told him: 'Master wait me at three pavilions south.'

sentences.zh: 與私約而去。

translations.literal: With private agreement left.

At this time, Qin Zhao Wang made ye zhe Wang Ji go to Wei. Zheng Anping falsely as soldier, served Wang Ji. Wang Ji asked: 'Wei has worthy person can with together west wander?' Zheng Anping said: 'Minister village has Zhang Lu master, wishes see lord, speak world affairs. That person has enmity, dares not day see.' Wang Ji said: 'Night with come.' Zheng Anping night with Zhang Lu saw Wang Ji. Conversation not complete, Wang Ji knew Fan Sui worthy, told him: 'Master wait me at three pavilions south.' With private agreement left.

sentences.zh: 王稽辭魏去，過載范睢入秦。

translations.literal: Wang Ji bid farewell Wei gone, passing carried Fan Sui enter Qin.

sentences.zh: 至湖，望見車騎從西來。

translations.literal: Arrived Hu, saw carriages riders from west coming.

sentences.zh: 范睢曰：「彼來者為誰？」

translations.literal: Fan Sui said: 'Those coming are who?'

sentences.zh: 王稽曰：「秦相穰侯東行縣邑。」

translations.literal: Wang Ji said: 'Qin chancellor Rang Hou east travel counties cities.'

sentences.zh: 范睢曰：「吾聞穰侯專秦權，惡內諸侯客，此恐辱我，我寧且匿車中。」

translations.literal: Fan Sui said: 'I heard Rang Hou monopolizes Qin authority, hates receives various lords guests, this fears humiliate me, I rather temporarily hide carriage middle.'

sentences.zh: 有頃，穰侯果至，勞王稽，因立車而語曰：「關東有何變？」

translations.literal: After while, Rang Hou indeed arrived, greeted Wang Ji, because standing carriage spoke: 'Guan east has what change?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「無有。」

translations.literal: Said: 'None.'

sentences.zh: 又謂王稽曰：「謁君得無與諸侯客子俱來乎？

translations.literal: Again told Wang Ji: 'Ye zhe you not with various lords guest sons come together?

sentences.zh: 無益，徒亂人國耳。」

translations.literal: No benefit, only disrupts people state.'

sentences.zh: 王稽曰：「不敢。」

translations.literal: Wang Ji said: 'Dare not.'

sentences.zh: 即別去。

translations.literal: Then parted went.

sentences.zh: 范睢曰：「吾聞穰侯智士也，其見事遲，鄉者疑車中有人，忘索之。」

translations.literal: Fan Sui said: 'I heard Rang Hou wise scholar, his seeing affairs slow, just now suspected carriage middle had person, forgot search it.'

sentences.zh: 於是范睢下車走，曰：「此必悔之。」

translations.literal: Then Fan Sui alighted ran, said: 'This certainly regret it.'

sentences.zh: 行十餘里，果使騎還索車中，無客，乃已。

translations.literal: Walked ten plus li, indeed made riders return search carriage middle, no guest, then stopped.

sentences.zh: 王稽遂與范睢入咸陽。

translations.literal: Wang Ji then with Fan Sui entered Xianyang.

translations.literal: Already reported envoy, because spoke: 'Wei has Zhang Lu master, world eloquent scholar.

translations.literal: Waited orders year plus.

sentences.zh: 當是時，昭王已立三十六年。

translations.literal: At this time, Zhao Wang already established thirty six years.

sentences.zh: 南拔楚之鄢郢，楚懷王幽死於秦。

translations.literal: South captured Chu Dang Ying, Chu Huai Wang imprisoned died in Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦東破齊。

translations.literal: Qin east broke Qi.

sentences.zh: 湣王嘗稱帝，後去之。

translations.literal: Min Wang once claimed emperor title, later abandoned it.

sentences.zh: 數困三晉。

translations.literal: Several times trapped three Jin.

sentences.zh: 厭天下辯士，無所信。

translations.literal: Disliked world eloquent scholars, none trusted.

At this time, Zhao Wang already established thirty six years. South captured Chu Dang Ying, Chu Huai Wang imprisoned died in Qin. Qin east broke Qi. Min Wang once claimed emperor title, later abandoned it. Several times trapped three Jin. Disliked world eloquent scholars, none trusted.

sentences.zh: 穰侯，華陽君，昭王母宣太后之弟也；

translations.literal: Rang Hou, Hua Yang Jun, Zhao Wang mother Xuan Taihou younger brother;

sentences.zh: 而涇陽君、高陵君皆昭王同母弟也。

translations.literal: Jing Yang Jun, Gao Ling Jun all Zhao Wang same mother younger brothers.

sentences.zh: 穰侯相，三人者更將，有封邑，以太后故，私家富重於王室。

translations.literal: Rang Hou chancellor, three persons alternated generals, had fief cities, because Taihou reason, private families rich heavy over royal house.

translations.literal: When Rang Hou as the state of Qin general, moreover wished cross Han, Wei attack Qi Gang Shou, wished broaden his Tao fief.

sentences.zh: 臣聞明主立政，有功者不得不賞，有能者不得不官，勞大者其祿厚，功多者其爵尊，能治眾者其官大。

translations.literal: Minister heard enlightened lord establishes governance, have merit not dare not reward, have ability not dare not appoint, labor great their salary thick, merit many their rank noble, able govern masses their office great.

sentences.zh: 故無能者不敢當職焉，有能者亦不得蔽隱。

translations.literal: Thus no ability dare not undertake position, have ability also not get concealed hidden.

translations.literal: Saying: 'Common lord rewards loved punishes hated;

sentences.zh: 明主則不然，賞必加於有功，而刑必斷於有罪。」

translations.literal: Enlightened lord then not so, reward certainly add to have merit, punishment certainly break at have crime.'

sentences.zh: 臣聞昔者呂尚之遇文王也，身為漁父而釣於渭濱耳。

translations.literal: Minister heard formerly Lu Shang encounter Wen Wang, body as fisherman fished Weishui bank.

sentences.zh: 若是者，交疏也。

translations.literal: Like this, relation distant.

sentences.zh: 已說而立為太師，載與俱歸者，其言深也。

translations.literal: Already persuaded established as grand master, loaded with together returned, his words deep.

sentences.zh: 故文王遂收功於呂尚而卒王天下。

translations.literal: Thus Wen Wang then received merit from Lu Shang finally king world.

sentences.zh: 鄉使文王疏呂尚而不與深言，是周無天子之德，而文武無與成其王業也。

translations.literal: When Qiao caused King Wen to distance Lü Shang without speaking deeply with him, this showed Zhou lacked the virtue of a Son of Heaven, and Wen and Wu were unable to complete their royal enterprise.

sentences.zh: 今臣羈旅之臣也，交疏於王，而所願陳者皆匡君之事，處人骨肉之閒，願效愚忠而未知王之心也。

translations.literal: Now your minister is a fettered wanderer, distantly related to the king, yet desires to correct all the lord's affairs in the state. Though placed between bone and flesh, he wishes to display foolish loyalty but does not know the king's heart.

sentences.zh: 此所以王三問而不敢對者也。

translations.literal: This is why Your Majesty has asked three times and I dared not answer.

sentences.zh: 臣非有畏而不敢言也。

translations.literal: Your minister is not afraid—he simply dares not speak.

sentences.zh: 臣知今日言之於前而明日伏誅於後，然臣不敢避也。

translations.literal: Minister know today speak at front tomorrow prostrate execute at rear, however minister dare not avoid.

sentences.zh: 大王信行臣之言，死不足以為臣患，亡不足以為臣憂，漆身為厲被髪為狂不足以為臣恥。
